title.narrative: Promoting sustainable industrial parks via South-South and triangular industrial cooperation platform

description.narrative: The overall objective of this project is to improve developing countries’ capacity for industrial park development, knowledge sharing and networking for the implementation of ISID thereby to contribute to poverty reduction efforts. It is foreseen to strengthen UNIDO’s role as a capacity-builder and knowledge and expertise-broker through South-South and triangular industrial cooperation (SSTIC) modality. The 2030 agenda recognizes knowledge sharing as a key pillar complementing financial and technical assistance to achieve SDGs. In this context, the project enables developing countries to acquire industrial knowledge and experiences needed to implement SDGs, particularly SDG9. South-South cooperation becomes a major knowledge instrument through replicating and upscaling good practices and technology transfer in developing countries. This project is initiated based on the recognition that developing countries increasingly want to learn from each other’s best experiences. This needs consolidation of in-house experiences, and innovative mechanisms for generating and managing industrial knowledge. Increasing awareness and promoting Southern narratives, solutions and alternatives for positive industrial development are crucial to meet the demands of Member States. The project is developed based on lessons learned from UNIDO project entitled “Establishing UNIDO Guiding Framework for industrial parks” that consolidated best practices on industrial parks and strengthened in-house cooperation between different departments. UNIDO approached the Permanent Mission of China and the Ministry of Commerce (MOFCOM) of China for possible financing and partnership in this project and affirmative response was received to finance the project. The project will be implemented by UNIDO within the framework of South-South and Triangular Industrial Cooperation (SSTIC). UNIDO mobilized partners from academia and development institutions such as the Chinese Academy of International Trade and Economic Cooperation (CAITEC), Center for International Knowledge on Development (CIKD), Asia-Pacific Finance and Development Institute (AFDI) and Chinese Academy of Social Science (CASS) for joint project implementation and will bring together all stakeholders to address the constraints. The project will stimulate South-South cooperation for exchange of industrial development ideas, technology transfer and knowledge exchange on industrial development, PCP/CP implementation, IDDA3 facilitation and other UNIDO multi-country initiatives. It will also provide capacity-building support for higher government officials in PCP and CP countries, organize study tours, establish online knowledge sharing platform, undertake joint studies and develop technical guidelines, manuals and tools to accelerate the implementation of ISID in developing countries.
